location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 28 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a translation of a letter from Zekee Khan addressed to the Senior Officer of the Marine in the Persian Gulf. The enclosure conveys the objections of the Government of Fars to the Resident's orders to Sooltan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Saqr] instructing him to destroy the fortifications he was in the process of rebuilding at Rassel Khyma [Ra's al-Khaymah]; it insists that all the inhabitants of the coast of the Persian Gulf are subject to the Government of Fars.
